{"step_by_step_thinking": "Tregs, or regulatory T cells, are a subset of T cells that modulate the immune system, maintain tolerance to self-antigens, and prevent autoimmune disease. They are generally suppressive and downregulate induction and proliferation of effector T cells. This means they do not positively regulate the immune response, but rather they control and suppress it to prevent overreaction and maintain balance.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
